sentences.english: S. cities to use electricity for street lighting. Population, 99,58.
sentences.chinese: 是一個工業中心及美國首先用電作街燈的城市之一。

sentences.english: Multi-storey brick buildings, asphalt, lampposts, traffic signs.
sentences.chinese: 這裏有多層磚房，瀝青路，街燈，交通標誌。

sentences.english: The breeze set the flames of the street lamps quavering.
In the glare from the street-light, I could see Dill hatching one.
sentences.chinese: 在耀眼的街燈下我看得出迪爾又在打鬼主意。

sentences.english: UFOs reports were most likely to be misidentified street lamps.
sentences.chinese: 大多數情況都是市民誤把街燈之類的認做UFO。

sentences.english: Street lights and car headlights are fuzzy.
sentences.chinese: 街燈和汽車大燈都模糊不清。

sentences.english: The engine and horses are displayed on a street with street lights and a fire hydrant.
sentences.chinese: 引擎和馬匹都顯示在一街與街燈和一個消防栓。

sentences.english: The gas street lamps glowed dully, blobs of yellow in the fog.
sentences.chinese: 街燈暗淡地照着，像霧中一些昏黃的斑點似的。

sentences.english: Open the Street Lamp image and extract it from the background.
sentences.chinese: 打開街燈圖片，將它從背景摳出。

sentences.english: The old street lamp shone all around him brightly.
sentences.chinese: 舊街燈把他周圍的一切照的亮亮的。

sentences.english: He likes the night scenes with some colorful light around the river and some buskers singing or dancing on the river bank.
sentences.chinese: 他喜歡夜間愛河畔那五光十色與街燈五彩繽紛的景色。

sentences.english: The street light shone on the brass number on his collar.
sentences.chinese: 街燈照在他那領章的銅號碼上。

sentences.english: The street light shone on the met'snumarer on his collar.
sentences.chinese: 街燈照在他那領章的銅號碼上。

sentences.english: Where street lights twinkle, carrying my piercing pain.
sentences.chinese: 那裏的街燈一閃一閃，承載着我撕心裂肺的痛。

sentences.english: The street lights go on at dusk.
He looks over your shoulder. The streetlight is still and thick.
sentences.chinese: 他從你的肩上望出窗外，街燈灑下濃厚的靜謐。

definition: (of a city etc) ablaze with lights
to stop burning/to go out (of fire)/to die out/extinguished
candle light/candle-lit (vigil etc)/candela, unit of luminous intensity (cd)
time/period during the day/one of the 12 two-hour periods enumerated by the earthly branches 地支
